review: There's no better place in northern Idaho to discuss purple dildos and Japanese sex robots. Burgers were good.

Two years ago, my husband and I had a bad experience with this restaurant: our waitress spent so long talking loudly to the patrons behind us (about how turquoise could apparently cure cancer if people would just give it a try) that she forgot about our food. The cook brought it out, literally slammed the plates on our table, and stalked off angrily. The food was completely cold. When we tried to mention this to the waitress, she just kept talking about how turquoise cured her roommate's acne and ignored us. No, I'm not making this up. We put cash on the table and walked out - she didn't even notice us leave! Today, we decided to give Applebee's a second chance. After all, things change a lot in two years, right? Sadly, not in this case. Please note through the review that, other than two other tables and us, the place was empty. Strike #1: Our waitress was sexist. When she came to our table, without even saying hello or welcome, she immediately delved into a story about how wonderful her 4th of July was. There's certainly nothing wrong with mentioning that you had a wonderful holiday, but this was a very lengthy and pointless story about one of her friends nearly blowing his fingers off for no reason, which she ended with "and it's pretty much a fact that all men are stupid." Even though neither of us said a thing, she then said defensively to my husband, "I'm allowed to say men are stupid, because I have five brothers. I'm the oldest sister. And they were all dumb." My husband stayed quiet, so she rolled her eyes and said, "Okay, you don't agree? Whatever. Well, what do you want to drink then?"  Strike #2: The Thermostat. It was absolutely freezing, and a vent was directly above us. I asked our waitress if she could please turn the air conditioning down a little. "No," she said, pointing at a table seated with two older ladies in heavy sweaters, "because they asked me 20 minutes ago to turn it up and if I turn it down for you, it'll just get hot and they'll complain, and in the summer all restaurants are either super hot or freezing anyways." When my husband asked if we could move to a table without a vent overhead, she said, "Oh, trust me, this is the warmest section of the restaurant, and totally the warmest table, it'll be colder everywhere else." Strike 3: Ordering. When she took our order, I asked for a burger, medium. She said, "Oh, we only do burgers in "pink" or "no pink", so you have to pick one of those. We don't do "just a little pink." She didn't write down our order (one burger, a sandwich, and soup), and my husband ended up with the wrong type of sandwich. Strike 4: The Food Itself. The onion soup my husband ordered was, essentially, mildly flavored brown water with oil bubbles floating on the top and a gargantuan hunk of semi-melted cheese. We both tried a bite, but it was so bad that we shared my burger (which was incredibly pink inside, but at least tasted all right) instead. The only thing that actually tasted good was the brownie bite my husband added to make himself feel better about his bad food. I've eaten at other Applebee's locations over the years, and I've had both good food and good service from them! It just seems to be that the food and service at THIS particular location is lacking. Maybe we'll give them a third chance in another two years...

Tried their new items, hubby got the sweet Asian pineapple burger, one of the fur kids got a kids grilled chicken with white rice and I got the pepper crusted sirloin and whole grains to go.  Two words, surprisingly good! Hubby's burger was flavorful with pineapple chunks and sweet chili sauce, for a $1 more he added bacon and looked like they used a pretzel bun, fries were a little over seasoned though. My steak was tender and a little well done, wish they let you choose the doneness on it as I like mine medium rare, grains and portobello mushrooms were a great compliment to the dish. Fur kid's grilled chicken breast was a generous portion and I couldn't stop stealing them as I was cutting them into chunks! Applebee's have definitely stepped up their game.

Bloody Mary was the worst. Plenty of Tabasco,  but no flavor. Asked waitress how much the drinks were before ordering. But when the bill came, they were about a dollar more. Asked for a salad substitute instead of a baked potato. When I got the bill, I found that they had charged $5.00 more for a side salad, even though  I didn't have a baked patato. Manager preferred to argue rather than to please the customer.  Will never eat at this place again!

I'll start with the positive: this Applebees has a very friendly staff and great environment compared to other Applebees. I also found the appetizers to be decent. I keep making the mistake of ordering burgers at this place. Numerous times I have tried their burgers and each time couldn't get them down. They are SO dry and overcooked but I am always deceived by the photo on the menu of yummy juicy burgers. I have also had their babyback ribs and they have little meat and as well dry, overcooked. I think I have learned my lesson.... Applebee's is a fun place for drinks and appetizers but their entrees are usually so-so or not good at all.
server was very attentive and tried to keep the mood fun. I love their diverse menu. food is usually pretty good and plentiful

I normally am not a huge fan of Applebee's. It's always just been fine, generic food that hasn't excited me too much. But this Applebee's? I actually crave going here. For one, the atmosphere is better than any I've been to before. The servers have always been super nice and helpful, they'll actually have a conversation with you and take the time to joke around a bit. The food has been really good here. And if you go after 9pm, all appetizers are half off! The chicken wonton tacos are delicious, just don't think you're going to take them home to eat the next day, they get soggy. The spinach artichoke dip is so yummy, also.  The onion rings look SO good, I'm going to have to try them. My friends that I often go with always get the mozzarella sticks and say they are really tasty. Portion sizes here are also pretty decent! My only food complaint? They don't make malted milkshakes! Fail. Their regular milkshakes are good though anyway. I went there on a Friday night once and they had karaoke. It was definitely very lively and there were lots of interesting people there, but listening to bad singers gets a tad annoying after awhile.

Friends and I often come here for drinks and appetizers. Service is decent, had a mix up with the way I was charged once. I called in to have it cleared up, apparently it was the day of a big football game and the employee who answered the phone said he was sorry, but they were incredibly busy and to call back in 3-4 hours. I barely stuttered out an "ok" before he hung up on me. Okay, no biggie, called back in 4 hours and it got totally cleared up within a few days. Food is alright, drinks are definitely alright - had great service the last couple of times I went by. I'll be back.

I've been several times and this Applebee's is better than most that I have been to , the appetizer sampler is my favorite, the service has always been great and the staff friendly nice place to eat with the family
Good time, good food, our server was great(name started with a "K") sorry.My fault Couldn't be better

Straight up, this Applebee's has the nicest employees of any I've ever been in. Long story short, I was left homeless in Pullman with few friends to count on last Fall. I came here to drown my sorrows in a beer and some food. Now, I don't really care for Applebee's food, but I knew their bar had some decent drinks, so I stopped on in.  The bartender was sweet as pie as she chatted me up and I told her my sob story. The restaurant manager overheard our chatter, and noticed me watching intently the college football came on the TV, and came over and sat next to me. He talked football with me for a good while and made me feel a little at ease for the first time that day. It felt good to have someone at a restaurant reach out to poor little homeless, so far from home, me.  I had a few beers, and the bartender and the manager wished me luck on the rest of my evening. I'll be over in the Palouse this weekend, maybe I'll have to make a stop by to say hello to the friendliest Applebee's employees I've ever encountered! And the beer was great too ;)

Understaffed, unprepared, and unapologetic. Called at 3 PM to let the know a large group was coming at 8. Arrived at 8 just to wait an 1.5 hours for a lukewarm burger and onion rings with the skin still attached. Talked to the manager and was told that five people too many showed up. They only fed five people out of twenty five within a reasonable time. Have been there before and always disappointed.
2 for $20 was good. Fast service. Can't say it was any better or worse than any other Applebee's I have been too.

We came here on a late night drive and needed some food. It is what you would expect from any sit down restaurant chain. Service is average, food is decent and prices are affordable for the most part. They do have a good deal on appetizers after 9 pm, they are half off. They do serve drinks as well, but expect to pay restaurant prices for those. Otherwise, stop in if no other good places are open.
I've been to my fair share of Applebee's in my life (San Jose,CA...South Lake Tahoe...Davis, CA...Vacaville, CA) but this one was the best!

We were traveling here from out of town,  and decided to eat here as it was close to our hotel and we had not had Applebee's in a long time as it's not close to us in Seattle, WA. This Applebee's is very delicious. We were very impressed with this Applebee's compared to other locations we had been to. It was a nice atmosphere, a mix of families and college students from U of I nearby. The service of the staff was overall great and they were kind and efficient. The only reason for the four stars was the Quesadilla appetizer did not come exactly as described and was not that hot when it came out. The server checked on us frequently,  but she overall did not seem happy.  I had the Chicken Tenders with the four cheese macaroni and it was delicious. I have had it many times before and this Applebee's served it best! My best friend had the Chicken Caesar Salad and she enjoyed it as well and it was fresh. I had the Blondie for dessert and it is so good! The Blondie is always great and I highly recommend it as a dessert to try!  Overall, it was a great experience and I recommend it if you are seeking a good place to eat in Moscow!

Applebee's - 3 stars  Applebee's makes some decent steak dinners. Their meals are competitively priced with the other restaurants. In my opinion they give good value for their prices. The staff is really nice and helpful. The atmosphere is warm and friendly. This is a great place to go if you want a quality restaurant meal for an affordable price. The sides are not my favorite, but that's just my opinion.
It was a good meal for my family and we had great sevase and everybody had a fun time and the servers were great and they held the doors for us

All I can say is this Applebees stands up to their wonderful reputation. Our server is on the ball and our drinks are constantly flowing. The two for $25 meal got the wings as an appetizer.  Ribs and the bourbon chicken as our main meals. We are leftovers for tomorrow. I just love this place. They make you feel like you're family.

Attention to tourists and travelers, if you are ever in Moscow and are in desperate need of food, fear not! Applebee's is here to save the day!!! In Moscow, there aren't that many choices when it comes down to food. However, you certainly can't go wrong with Applebee's. I have gone to many Applebee's in SoCal and here, the service is definitely better and more prompt. I think this is partly due to the fact that there is no one is Moscow and therefore, less customers at Applebee's, allowing the servers to be more attentive.  In terms of the food, it's just standard American cuisine. I had the honey BBQ boneless wings as appetizers. Unfortunately, they went too strong on the sauce and the BBQ was simply too overwhelming. For entree, I ordered the 8oz sirloin steak with honey pecan sweet mashed potato and garlic green beans. I asked for the steak to be medium rare and it was cooked perfect to order (see picture). The fact that it was also next to the pecan sweet mashed potato also gave the steak a gentle, sweet, smoky flavor, which was an excellent addition to the overall aroma of the steak. The sides however, were disappointing. The sweet mashed potato was wayyyy too sweet. At one point, I felt like I was drinking drops of honey. I think I should have had it along with the steak, but I ate it separately. The green beans did not taste garlicky. It was pretty bland overall. Tastes pretty much like boiled green beans in water. I would give the food 3 stars. However due to the attentive service and the fact that they actually have Applebee's at Moscow, I would give this place an overall rating of 4 stars. Thank god for Applebee's so that I didn't have to drive out 2 hours to eat decent American food.

Service at this Applebee's is always surprisingly great! The food is standard Applebee's food...looks great on TV and on the menu but looks and tastes subpar in real life. We come here if we're in the area but it's not something that we crave or intentionally go to. At least the service is decent and it's right next to the freeway/Walmart!

We stopped in after being ignored by Buffalo Wild Wings, so we were not in a good mood. However we were greeted with a smile and exceptional service for a chain restaurant. John, our waiter was attentive to our needs and the manager was displaying servant leadership to his employees and customers. This was the best service we have ever experienced at Applebee's!

We stopped in for late night happy hour before retiring to the hotel next door.  The "perfect" margarita was anything but.  It was godawful.  Waaay too sweet without any hint of tequila.  My companion had a bourbon berry cocktail that was equally sugary.  The entire cocktail menu was full of sugar bomb drinks.  There are several other great places in Moscow to choose over this place.

I came here during Happy Hour 9pm-12am (something like that) because that's when appetizers (and some drinks) are 50% off. I ordered the spinach and artichoke dip that cost only $4. It was quite tasty too. The boneless wings weren't anything special and the onion rings were crisp on the outside (but not in the inside). But that's standard for most chain restaurants so I'm not too surprised. However, the waitress was friendly and attentive which is not always a given. Oh! And the burger I ordered did have a generous amount of bacon in it which was also awesome. Overall, I'd say it's a great place to go to if you're craving affordable, decent-tasting food late at night.  There's also the 2 for $20 deal where you  can pick an appetizer and two entrees. It's perfect for when you want to split the bill between two people!  PS: I loved the music that was being played. Good vibes.

What a surprise! Best Applebees ever! Although the margaritas were weak on the alcohol side (not necessarily a bad thing), the grilled steak dinner was excellent, while the pork steak with mashed sweet potatoes and garlic green beans was unbelievably good. Serving sizes are filling, the presentations are unaustentatious, appealing and appetizing. I'm so glad we decided to take a chance on it. We were so excited, though, that we forgot to request our 10% off!

the food is standard Applebees. the service is horrendous. while staying at la quinta for an extended period of time, a group and myself would visit applebees nightly around 11pm for about a week. there were only three of us but the manager would comment on how "the cooks were going to kill us" and make remarks that we were showing up too late (one hour before close). these were not comments made in jest, they were borderline aggressive. one night the staff turned the music up to an extreme level around 11:40 in order to get us to leave faster.  we were a well behaved bunch who tipped well didn't drink alcohol before or during any of our visits. constantly we were berated by the manager. I'm sorry we showed up to order $70 worth of food and appetizers at your restaurant for so many nights. should have taken our business elsewhere

Limeade was way too sweet. Celery looked like they were trying to cut costs by using every last bit in the bit in the bunch and we got stuck with the trimmings. Server brought me the wrong beer first time around.  Appetizers selection is pretty good. The build your own sampler is fun and a nice if you and a friend just want to munch on a bunch of different plates. Good place to sit and drink while watching a game.

This is not my first visit here, but I can honestly say it was the worst visit.  First we waited over 10 minutes when there was an open booth for 2 people sitting vacant the whole time (we were the only party of 2 in the waiting area).  Then we ended up seated next to an Applebee's employee who not only got fast service, but had the whole wait staff stop by at least 2 times.  Maybe he was a big deal or something.... My daughter ordered strawberry lemonade and what ever they brought her looked like country time lemonade with no strawberries whatsoever. It was nasty and way too sweet.  My Long Island iced tea was the usual - mostly ice and not much drink. Our food was the usual fare and not really any complaints there, but I do have to say the experience overall was not as pleasant as our last visit.  I do not think we will be back to this particular location.
Shoutout to the waitress Rochelle. She is by far the best server we have had in a long time. Thank you for the great experience and great drinks!

The food was good but the service was not that great. I ordered the double crunch shrimp. It tasted amazing. After we ordered the food took a long time for it to be delivered to our table. But it was well worth the wait. Even though the service was slow the staff was nice. I would definitely go back.

The service was good, but that was it. When our waiter was checking us out, he used the tablet device at the table, and that told us the total was 90.88 when our true total was 61.98. We also noticed we were charged for a game, but we did not play any games. After waiting for the waiter to walk by again,  we flagged him down and asked about the discrepancy. He then did the charge himself on an actual computer, but did not remove the game charge. Then the tablet device set waiting with our charge still on it waiting for "approval" to be hit,  we weren't about to walk away with our payment pending like that. The waiter explained it would time out in 5 minutes but we waited and it didn't. We manually shut the thing off so our card couldn't be charged again. Between being charged extra on the machine and being charged for a game we did not play, we will not be returning to this location.

I was hoping to go my entire life without eating at Applebee's, but I had to attend a birthday party here and couldn't escape. There were a lot of staff and they all seemed friendly, but the food was really bad. The restaurant is located right next to Wal-Mart and Shari's, so that tells you everything you need to know about the kind of diners who actually choose to eat this mass-produced swill over all the other quality, local restaurants we have in Moscow. The food prices are reasonable, but they make their profits on high-priced beer.

I'll admit I can be a bit if a food snob, but if you are into forking over your hard earned cash to have other people nuke your TV dinners who am I to judge? But this particular Applebee's is one you should just steer clear of. The last time I went there my fish was more charcoal than fish and my potatoes tasted like they had been under a heat lamp all day. Bottom line is there are just better establishments to frequent around here.

Server was very nice. I ordered a 9oz. House steak and asked for medium rare. Steak was over cooked. They offered to remake it but I said it was fine. They made up for it and bought me dessert. Other than that food was great, service and staff were great, and the dessert was amazing! Will definitely be coming back!
My Mom and I took my sister to lunch for her birthday today and we had a good time. The waitress was friendly and very professional. Our food was fresh and hot. Would definitely recommend this place.
